sources.snippet: Merchants who accepted Visa and Mastercard payments between 2004 and 2019 are now eligible for compensation under a historic $5.5 billion class action settlement. This settlement addresses claims that Visa and Mastercard overcharged merchants with excessive interchange fees, violating U.S. antitrust laws.

sources.title: Payment card interchange fee and merchant discount antitrust litigation
